content.description: Short and dirty. Sit start on the down hill side of the north face and ride the lip until you hit the arete. Head straight up from there. The crux is not dabbing on a small rock that follows the line.
content.location: North side of the Red Green Show boulder.

content.description: Sit start on good edges with a right heel. Work through a couple of amazing crimps and compression moves. Head straight up to a tricky top out.
content.location: This problem is located on the South side of the boulder underneath an obvious overhang.

content.description: Variation of Red Green Show that works out left using small crimps under the roof to a credit card crimp on the left face. Use the arete and a few holds on either side to work your way up to a potentially comical finish on the left face.
content.protection: Two pads, a spotter would be nice.
content.location: Same as for Red Green Show.

content.description: This is the down climb for Red Green Show but hosts some amazing crimps and edges on a slight slab. Worth playing around on.
content.location: This problem is found on the West face (cliff side) of the boulder.

content.description: The Red Green Show boulder was first found by Reed Rombough. He put up the main line "Red Green Show" (hence the name) on this boulder in the Spring of 2015. There are two other problems on this boulder that are unnamed and will be very dirty, as they go unclimbed for long periods of time.
